contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=April 2011}} {{Infobox Paris metro |Name=Gallieni |Subtitle=Parc de Bagnolet |Pic=Île-de-France RATP MP 67 n°132 M3 Gallieni.jpg |Day=2 April |Year=1971 |Access=Av. du Général de Gaulle<br>Bus depot |Municipality=Bagnolet |Zone=1 |Next= {{Paris Metro/next special|3|[[Porte de Bagnolet (Paris Metro)|Porte de Bagnolet]]|Terminus}} | X=229 | Y=67 }} '''Gallieni (Parc de Bagnolet)''' is a station on [[Paris Métro Line 3]], being its eastern terminus. It was opened on 2 April 1971 when the line was extended from [[Gambetta (Paris Métro)|Gambetta]]. It is situated on the ''Avenue Gallieni'', which is named after General [[Joseph Gallieni]], famous for commandeering 600 taxis to take troops to the front to help save Paris during the [[First Battle of the Marne]] in 1914. It is next door to a large international bus station serving bus services from [[Eurolines]]. ==References== {{Paris Metro/line 3}} {{Paris-metro-stub}} {{coord|48.86350|2.41578|region:FR_type:landmark_scale:2000_source:frwiki|display=title|format=dms}} [[Category:Railway stations opened in 1971]]
